Host.description: The host name, and optionally port, on which the PostgreSQL database is running.

Database.description: The PosgreSQL to connect to. If left blank, the username is used.

Username.description: The PostgreSQL username to connect with.

Password.description: The password for the specified PostgreSQL user.

Sharding.description: Defines how this instance will handle sharding.

StartId.description: The shard ID that this instance will initialize first.

Amount.description: Total amount of shards this instance will host, beginning with StartId.

Total.description: Total amount of shards run by the bot. MUST be the same across instances.

Interval.description: The amount of shards to initialize at once. Discord usually limits this to 2 before enforcing rate limits.

DBotsToken.description: Token for submitting statistics to Discord Bots.

StatusInterval.description: Interval between status updates, in seconds.

MaxConcurrentOperations.description: The maximum amount of background operations that can run concurrently.

BackgroundInterval.description: How often background tasks are run per shard, in seconds.

LogConnectionStatus.description:
Whether to show common connect and disconnect events, and other messages regarding connection to Discord.
This is disabled in the public instance, but is worth keeping enabled in self-hosted bots.
